results.title: Questions
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Bruce Moir and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The “God rich colony” is a huge industrial estate on the outskirts of Bombay. It is a self-contained company town where everything is provided for the factory workers and their families, including schools. An Australian director and a group of 15 year-old school children have a relaxed discussion about their concept of the Australian way of life and their lives in India.

results.title: Questions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
The PGR team answers specific questions sent in by viewers from all over Australia. Subjects covered include sleep problems, teaching young children different languages, expressing and storing breast milk, nutritional problems and health matters, such as trimming babies’ nails., appropriate sun protection, circumcision, flat feet and weak ankles. We also offer tips for concerned parents of adopted children, compare different methods of introducing the alphabet to pre-schoolers, and discuss what is “normal” behaviour in young boys.

results.title: Question. Communicate. Close
results.brief_description: Presented by Jo Hall, this video which takes a good Customer Service person and shows them how to be a great Sales Person. Different vignettes have been chosen to demonstrate the major points of a sales role. The focus is on the skills of questioning, communicating, recognising buying signals and closing the sale. In talking about these areas, this program highlights the difference between satisfying a customer enquiry and turning that enquiry into a sale. It is presented in a generic, rather than industry specific, fashion which gives the video broad appeal to a range of industries. Includes a Leaders guide, Participants workbook and Overhead transparencies.

results.title: Question of silence = De Stilte rond Christine M.
results.creator_credit: Sigma Films, Matthijs van Heijningen and Marleen Gorris
results.brief_description: Lauded as one of the key feminist films of the period, ‘Question of silence’ was the first feature film by feminist Dutch filmmaker, Marlene Gorris. 3 women - a housewife, a secretary and a waitress - strangers united by their gender and the resultant oppression that ensues, and by the charge that they collaborated in the unmotivated murder of a male shop keeper. A female psychiatrist is entrusted with proving the women are not of sane mind, as the legal rationale is that they would have to have been insane, why else would they kill a man in an act of random violence? A question that is not asked when the gender roles of victim/offender are reversed. The psychiatrist is met by resistance in the women, silence in fact. One chooses not the speak, the other speaks too much, the third tells lies and half truths. It is only through this silence that the women are able to wield any power, something the psychiatrist begins to appreciate as she too becomes aware of the suffocation and suppression within her marriage and the male judicial system within which she works. Much has been made of the closing scenes, which have to be seen to be believed. Cast includes Cox Habbema, Nelly Fridja, Henriette Tol and Eddy Brugman. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: Question of prejudice
results.brief_description: A study of the racist atitudes of some Australians toward migrant Australians, highligting the ‘wog’ syndrome. Investigtes the discrimination shown in the workforce towards groups such as the Lebanese, and its human effects such as the loss of self-esteem. Includes the views of Robert Cameron (White Australia Movement) and children.

results.title: Question of immunity
results.brief_description: Shows damage caused by disease and explains how the body combats toxins and disease-causing bacteria. Explains that the body’s own defence mechanism is the biggest obstacle to successful organ transplants. This is a lucid exposition of the manner in which the human body’s defences identify and reject intruders such as foreign proteins, bacteria or viruses. Animation and microphotography illustrate some of the known facts: the action of white blood cells and the response of the lymphatic system.

results.title: Question in Togoland: A Pictorial report
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The life, homes, school, occupations, religion, music and arts of the people of Togoland. The country, which has been under U.N. trusteeship, is prepared for a plebiscite. Each voter learns how to designate either union with the Gold Coast or continued trusteeship. As a result of the plebiscite Togoland joined the Gold Coast in the new nation of Ghana.

results.title: Quest for power
results.creator_credit: Vara-TV, Stichting Derde Cinema, Saul Landau and Frank Diamond
results.brief_description: A probing and well-conceived documentary about the values, style and goals of a new, radical right-wing movement in the United States known as the ‘New Right’. Demonstrates the power and the persuasiveness of the ‘New Right’ from a critical and a logical perspective. Key figures in this group express their distaste for homosexuality, abortion, blacks, arms control or any kind of agreement with the Soviets. Leaders of the ‘New Right’ such as President Reagan are shown.

results.title: Quest for perfection: A look at trampolining
results.creator_credit: Setag Educational Films and Dick Gates
results.brief_description: A look at the art of trampolining, with Paul Luxton champion British trampolinist demonstrating the skills that make him a champion. There are six categories of movements in trampolining, and three body shapes tucked, pike and straight. Trampolinists have modified many established dives by landing on the back or the chest, and these modifications are demonstrated. Luxton finally demonstrates a sequence of double and triple somersaults with any number of twists, showing that trampolining, like gymnastics, proceeds into art and does represent an aesthetic achievement.
